key_points: Tiger Woods was involved in a serious car accident on Tuesday, requiring extraction by firefighters and paramedics.
He was transported to a hospital with multiple leg injuries and is undergoing surgery.
Woods was in Los Angeles for the PGA Tour's Genesis Invitational and had participated in trophy presentation.
The golfing community, including Jay Monahan and Max Homa, and Woods' team have expressed their support and prayers for his recovery.
Celebrities like Lindsey Vonn, LeBron James, and Alex Rodriguez have also sent well-wishes to Woods.
Prior to the accident, Woods was engaged in a two-day shoot with Golf Digest/Golf TV and celebrities such as Jada Pinkett Smith and Dwyane Wade.
The day before the crash, Woods golfed with David Spade and Jada Pinkett Smith, expressing enjoyment over the experience.
Tiger Woods had undergone a microdiscectomy procedure in January for a pinched nerve.
Woods had a car crash in 2009 and was arrested under suspicion of DUI in 2017, each time addressing the incidents publicly.
Despite recent surgery, Woods mentioned feeling hopeful for participating in the upcoming Masters tournament though uncertain about his recovery timeline.
spokespersons: Jay Monahan (Commissioner of the PGA Tour)
